Title: AN ACT APPROPRIATING SEVEN THOUSAND AND NINETY-TWO PESOS FOR THE IMPROVEMENT OF BUILDINGS AND GROUNDS AT BAGUIO, BENGUET.(awÞhi(
Data:
[ Act No. 2201, December 21, 1912 ]
AN ACT APPROPRIATING SEVEN THOUSAND AND NINETY-TWO PESOS FOR THE IMPROVEMENT OF BUILDINGS AND GROUNDS AT BAGUIO, BENGUET.(awÞhi(
By authority of the United States, be it enacted by the Philippine Commission, that:
Section 1. There is hereby appropriated, out of any Appropriation, funds in the Insular Treasury not otherwise appropriated, for improving the sanitary condition of small cottages inhabited by Filipino employees at Baguio; for installing open drains in connection therewith; for providing baths and sinks in such cottages; and for the construction of gravel walks and the provision of adequate lighting at night, seven thousand and ninety-two pesos, which sum shall be expended by the Bureau of Public Works.
Section 2. This Act shall take effect on its passage.
Enacted, December 21, 1912.
